title: Can royalty free music be used commercially? - Quora

response.answer_text: Royalty-Free music means you are not paying a per-use fee, once for each display to a different person. It means you are paying a flat fee, possibly as low as zero. Thus it is different than “free”. You can use that music in accordance with the terms of the use license that is given to you. Hopefully you are getting one that matches your planned use.  It is not uncommon for some recording artists to allow their music to be completely free to people that are not using it commercially, and then to ask for a single upfront fee to get a royalty-free license that allows commercial use. If you’re making money, they want to make some money. Really, that’s only fair. But again, the terms of the use license are the deciding factor here, not how much you paid.
Yes, you can use Youtube library music free of cost anywhere.
Your license will tell you that. Check before you purchase a license; as some RF music is only for personal use.
